title: definitions
para: access  illustration  An  access  illustration  is  a  data  module  with  one  or  more   illustrations  used  to  support  the  navigation  of  an  interactive   publication.

title: Terms  and  definitions  -  Introduction
para: Business  Rule  (BR)  A  rule  that  has  been  applied  by  a  project  or  an  organization   about  how  to  implement  a  particular  aspect  of  S1000D  and   is  normally  the  result  of  a  business  rule  decision.

title: Terms
para: Chap  2.5.1  Business  rules  -  Categories  and  layers   Chap  2.5.2  Business  rules  -  Generation  and  use   Chap  2.5.3  Business  rules  -  Index

title: Motion
para: The  examples  given  after  the  definitions  of  each  business  rules  category  in  Para  2.1  thru   Para  2.10  are  not  exhaustive  and  are  only  intended  to  provide  the  reader  with  a  guide  how   these  categories  of  rules  can  be  covered.  The  word  "must"  means  in  this  example  that  a  certain   business  rule  must  be  followed  only  by  this  particular  example  project  or  organization.

title: definitions  -  Introduction
para: An  implementation  guide  will  offer  guidance  for  S1000D  implementation  in  its  various  facets.

title: Parhfinder
para: access  illustration  An  access  illustration  is  a  data  module  with  one  or  more   illustrations  used  to  support  the  navigation  of  an  interactive   publication.

title: Documnets
para: Business  Rule  (BR)  A  rule  that  has  been  applied  by  a  project  or  an  organization   about  how  to  implement  a  particular  aspect  of  S1000D  and   is  normally  the  result  of  a  business  rule  decision.

title: Terms  and  definitions  -  Introduction
para: Chap  2.5.1  Business  rules  -  Categories  and  layers   Chap  2.5.2  Business  rules  -  Generation  and  use   Chap  2.5.3  Business  rules  -  Index

title: Knowledege
para: A  business  rules  category  is  a  unique  grouping  that  describes  rules  applicable  to  product   definition,  maintenance  philosophy,  concepts  of  operation,  security,  business  processes,  data   creation,  data  exchange,  data  integrity,  data  output  and/or  legacy  data  conversion,   management,  handling  and  other  issues.

title: Real Time
para: The  examples  given  after  the  definitions  of  each  business  rules  category  in  Para  2.1  thru   Para  2.10  are  not  exhaustive  and  are  only  intended  to  provide  the  reader  with  a  guide  how   these  categories  of  rules  can  be  covered.  The  word  "must"  means  in  this  example  that  a  certain   business  rule  must  be  followed  only  by  this  particular  example  project  or  organization.

title: Workspace
para: An  implementation  guide  will  offer  guidance  for  S1000D  implementation  in  its  various  facets.
